text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with how to cut a sandwich like
chef bobby flay before sandwich cutting
visionary bobby flay came along there
were two ways to cut a sandwich straight
crossed or on the diagonal but now
thanks to this incredible breakthrough
we have a third way you're going to put
your knife across like you're going to
do a straight diagonal cut but you're
going to tilt the knife in a 45 degree
angle also known as a bias cut by the
way I was trying to figure out how to do
this without blocking the lens with my
you know big hairy paw and I couldn't
figure it out so pardon the hand and
what happens when you cut something on a
bias at an angle whether it's a piece of
bread whether it's a flank steak you get
a larger surface area which gives the
impression the illusion of much more
filling it's not really more filling it
just looks like it and it's tough to see
from straight on but if you look at this
side view you can see what happened
there see by cutting at that angle we
have just more surface area that gives
that appearance and makes the filling
much more prominent visually okay so
kind of a neat trick Thank You chef
bobby flay for that technique
next time you're cutting sandwiches
think to yourself I should probably turn
this knife a little bit to expose more
of the fillings and you know what yes
